required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Trial in Adult Subjects With Acute Migraines
clinical_study.official_title: BHV3000-303: Phase 3, Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo Controlled, Safety and Efficacy Trial of BHV-3000 (Rimegepant) Orally Disintegrating Tablet (ODT) for the Acute Treatment of Migraine

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the efficacy of BHV-3000 (rimegepant ODT) versus placebo in subjects with Acute Migraines.

study_design_info.masking_description: Double-blind to Sponsor, Investigator and Participant

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Pain at 2 Hours Post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Pain levels were assessed on a 4-point scale (none, mild, moderate, severe) using the electronic diary (eDiary). Pain freedom was defined as pain level of none.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Most Bothersome Symptom (MBS) at 2 Hours Post-dose
primary_outcome.description: MBS was reported as nausea, photophobia, or phonophobia at migraine onset using the eDiary. Symptom status (absent, present) was assessed post-dose using the eDiary separately for nausea, photophobia, and phonophobia. Freedom from MBS was defined as MBS reported at onset that was absent post-dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Pain Relief at 2 Hours Post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Pain levels were assessed on a 4-point scale (none, mild, moderate, severe) using the eDiary. Pain relief was defined as pain level of none or mild.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Functional Disability at 2 Hours Post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Functional disability level was assessed in the eDiary on a 4-point scale: normal function, mild impairment, severe impairment, required bed rest. Freedom from functional disability was defined as normal function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Pain Relief From 2 to 24 Hours Post-dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 2 hours up to 24 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Pain levels were assessed on a 4-point scale (none, mild, moderate, severe) using the eDiary. Sustained pain relief was defined as pain level of none or mild at 2 hours up to 24 hours post-dose with no rescue medication use through 24 hours post-dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Freedom From Most Bothersome Symptom (MBS) From 2 to 24 Hours Post-dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 2 hours up to 24 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: MBS was reported as nausea, photophobia, or phonophobia at migraine onset using the eDiary. Symptom status (absent, present) was assessed post-dose using the eDiary separately for nausea, photophobia, and phonophobia. Sustained freedom was defined as MBS reported at onset that was absent at 2 hours up to 24 hours post-dose with no rescue medication use through 24 hours post-dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Rescue Medication Use Within 24 Hours Post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who did not experience relief of their migraine headache at the end of 2 hours after dosing with study medication (and after the 2-hour assessments had been completed on the eDiary) were permitted to use the following rescue medications: aspirin, ibuprofen, acetaminophen up to 1000 mg/day (this includes Excedrin Migraine), naproxen (or any other type of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug), antiemetics (e.g., metoclopramide or promethazine), or baclofen. The participant's use of rescue medication was recorded by the participant in a paper diary.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Freedom From Functional Disability From 2 to 24 Hours Post-dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 2 hours up to 24 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Functional disability level was assessed in the eDiary on a 4-point scale: normal function, mild impairment, severe impairment, required bed rest. Sustained freedom from functional disability was defined as normal function at 2 hours up to 24 hours post-dose with no rescue medication use through 24 hours post-dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Pain Relief From 2 to 48 Hours Post-dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 2 hours up to 48 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Pain levels were assessed on a 4-point scale (none, mild, moderate, severe) using the eDiary. Sustained pain relief was defined as pain level of none or mild at 2 hours up to 48 hours post-dose with no rescue medication use through 48 hours post-dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Freedom From Most Bothersome Symptom (MBS) From 2 to 48 Hours Post-dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 2 hours up to 48 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: MBS was reported as nausea, photophobia, or phonophobia at migraine onset using the eDiary. Symptom status (absent, present) was assessed post-dose using the eDiary separately for nausea, photophobia, and phonophobia. Sustained freedom was defined as MBS reported at onset that was absent at 2 hours up to 48 hours post-dose with no rescue medication use through 48 hours post-dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Freedom From Functional Disability From 2 to 48 Hours Post-dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 2 hours up to 48 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Functional disability level was assessed in the eDiary on a 4-point scale: normal function, mild impairment, severe impairment, required bed rest. Sustained freedom from functional disability was defined as normal function at 2 hours up to 48 hours post-dose with no rescue medication use through 48 hours post-dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Photophobia at 2 Hours Post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Photophobia (sensitivity to light) status was measured as absent or present in the eDiary. Freedom from photophobia was defined as photophobia absent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Functional Disability at 90 Minutes Post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Functional disability level was assessed in the eDiary on a 4-point scale: normal function, mild impairment, severe impairment, required bed rest. Freedom from functional disability was defined as normal function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Pain Relief at 90 Minutes Post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Pain levels were assessed on a 4-point scale (none, mild, moderate, severe) using the eDiary. Pain relief was defined as pain level of none or mild.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Pain Freedom From 2 to 24 Hours Post-dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 2 hours up to 24 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Pain levels were assessed on a 4-point scale (none, mild, moderate, severe) using the eDiary. Sustained pain freedom was defined as pain level of none at 2 hours up to 24 hours post-dose with no rescue medication use through 24 hours post-dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Most Bothersome Symptom (MBS) at 90 Minutes Post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: MBS was reported as nausea, photophobia, or phonophobia at migraine onset using the eDiary. Symptom status (absent, present) was assessed post-dose using the eDiary separately for nausea, photophobia, and phonophobia. Freedom from MBS was defined as MBS reported at onset that was absent post-dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Pain at 90 Minutes Post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Pain levels were assessed on a 4-point scale (none, mild, moderate, severe) using the electronic diary (eDiary). Pain freedom was defined as pain level of none.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Phonophobia at 2 Hours Post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Phonophobia (sensitivity to sound) status was measured as absent or present in the eDiary. Freedom from phonophobia was defined as phonophobia absent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Pain Freedom From 2 to 48 Hours Post-dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 2 hours up to 48 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Pain levels were assessed on a 4-point scale (none, mild, moderate, severe) using the eDiary. Sustained pain freedom was defined as pain level of none at 2 hours up to 48 hours post-dose with no rescue medication use through 48 hours post-dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Pain Relief at 60 Minutes Post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Pain levels were assessed on a 4-point scale (none, mild, moderate, severe) using the eDiary. Pain relief was defined as pain level of none or mild.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Functional Disability at 60 Minutes Post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Functional disability level was assessed in the eDiary on a 4-point scale: normal function, mild impairment, severe impairment, required bed rest. Freedom from functional disability was defined as normal function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Nausea at 2 Hours Post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Nausea status was measured as absent or present in the eDiary. Freedom from nausea was defined as nausea absent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Pain Relapse From 2 to 48 Hours Post-dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 2 hours up to 48 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Pain levels were assessed on a 4-point scale (none, mild, moderate, severe) using the eDiary. Pain relapse was defined as pain level of mild, moderate, or severe after 2 hours up to 48 hours post-dose for the participants who were pain-free at 2 hours post-dose.

arm_group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of 75 mg of rimegepant ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of matching placebo for rimegepant (75 mg) ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

intervention.description: Placebo ODT to match rimegepant dose QD

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subject has at least 1 year history of migraines (with or without aura), consistent with a diagnosis according to the International Classification of Headache Disorder, 3rd Edition, Beta version [1] including the following:
1. Migraine attacks present for more than 1 year with the age of onset prior to 50 years of age
2. Migraine attacks, on average, lasting about 4-72 hours if untreated
3. Not more than 8 attacks of moderate to severe intensity per month within the last 3 months
4. Consistent migraine headaches of at least 2 migraine headache attacks of moderate or severe intensity in each of the 3 months prior to the Screening Visit and maintains this requirement during the Screening period
5. Less than 15 days with headache (migraine or non-migraine) per month in each of the 3 months prior to the Screening Visit and maintains this requirement during the Screening Period.
6. Subjects on prophylactic migraine medication are permitted to remain on therapy provided they have been on a stable dose for at least 3 months prior to screening visit and the dose is not expected to change during the course of the study.
7. Subjects with contraindications for use of triptans may be included provided they meet all other study entry criteria.
Key Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subject with a history of HIV disease
2. Subject history with current evidence of uncontrolled, unstable or recently diagnosed cardiovascular disease, such as ischemic heart disease, coronary artery vasospasm, and cerebral ischemia. subjects with Myocardial Infarction (MI), Acute Coronary Syndrome (ACS), Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI), cardiac surgery, stroke or transient ischemic attack (TIA) during the 6 months prior to screening
3. Uncontrolled hypertension (high blood pressure), or uncontrolled diabetes (however subjects can be included who have stable hypertension and/or diabetes for at least 3 months prior to being enrolled)
4. Subject has a current diagnosis of major depression, other pain syndromes, psychiatric conditions (e.g., schizophrenia), dementia, or significant neurological disorders (other than migraine) that, in the Investigator's opinion might interfere with study assessments.
5. Subject has a history of gastric, or small intestinal surgery (including Gastric Bypass, Gastric Banding, Gastric Sleeve, Gastric Balloon, etc.), or has disease that causes malabsorption
6. The subject has a history of current or evidence of any significant and/ or unstable medical conditions (e.g., history of congenital heart disease or arrhythmia, known suspected infection, hepatitis B or C, or cancer) that, in the investigator's opinion, would expose them to undue risk of a significant adverse event (AE) or interfere with assessments of safety or efficacy during the course of the trial.
7. History of, treatment for, or evidence of, alcohol or drug abuse within the past 12 months or subjects who have met DSM-V criteria for any significant substance use disorder within the past 12 months from the date of the screening visit.
8. Subjects are excluded if they have previously participated in any BHV-30000 (rimegepant) study within the last 2 years.
9. Participation in any other investigational clinical trial while participating in this clinical trial

facility.name: Clinical Research Consortium, An AMR Company
Baptist Health Center for Clinical Research
Ki Health Partners LLC DBA New England Institute for Clinical Research
Cresent City Headache and Neurology Center LLC
New Orleans Center for Clinical Research
Community Clinical Research Network/Milford Emergency Associates, Inc
Texas Center for Drug Development, Inc.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at 69 centers in the United States.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Total 1811 participants were enrolled, of which 1466 were randomized to rimegepant 75 milligram (mg) orally disintegrating tablet (ODT) or placebo. Total 345 participants failed screening mainly due to failure to meet eligibility criteria. Randomization was stratified in 1:1 ratio based on use of prophylactic migraine medications (yes or no).

group.title: Rimegepant 75 mg ODT
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of 75 mg of rimegepant ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of matching placebo for rimegepant (75 mg) ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

baseline.population: The analysis was performed on modified intent to treat (mITT) participants, defined as those who were randomized only once, took study medication, had moderate to severe pain level at migraine onset, and who provided at least 1 post-baseline efficacy measurement (i.e., after taking study medication).

group.title: Rimegepant 75 mg ODT
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of 75 mg of rimegepant ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of matching placebo for rimegepant (75 mg) ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Functional Disability at 90 Minutes Post-dose
outcome.description: Functional disability level was assessed in the eDiary on a 4-point scale: normal function, mild impairment, severe impairment, required bed rest. Freedom from functional disability was defined as normal function.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on mITT participants.

group.title: Rimegepant 75 mg ODT
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of 75 mg of rimegepant ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of matching placebo for rimegepant (75 mg) ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Functional Disability at 90 Minutes Post-dose
measure.description: Functional disability level was assessed in the eDiary on a 4-point scale: normal function, mild impairment, severe impairment, required bed rest. Freedom from functional disability was defined as normal function.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on mITT participants.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Pain Relief at 90 Minutes Post-dose
outcome.description: Pain levels were assessed on a 4-point scale (none, mild, moderate, severe) using the eDiary. Pain relief was defined as pain level of none or mild.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on mITT participants.

group.title: Rimegepant 75 mg ODT
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of 75 mg of rimegepant ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of matching placebo for rimegepant (75 mg) ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Pain Relief at 90 Minutes Post-dose
measure.description: Pain levels were assessed on a 4-point scale (none, mild, moderate, severe) using the eDiary. Pain relief was defined as pain level of none or mild.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on mITT participants.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Pain Freedom From 2 to 24 Hours Post-dose
outcome.description: Pain levels were assessed on a 4-point scale (none, mild, moderate, severe) using the eDiary. Sustained pain freedom was defined as pain level of none at 2 hours up to 24 hours post-dose with no rescue medication use through 24 hours post-dose.
outcome.time_frame: From 2 hours up to 24 hours post-dose
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on mITT participants.

group.title: Rimegepant 75 mg ODT
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of 75 mg of rimegepant ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of matching placebo for rimegepant (75 mg) ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Pain Freedom From 2 to 24 Hours Post-dose
measure.description: Pain levels were assessed on a 4-point scale (none, mild, moderate, severe) using the eDiary. Sustained pain freedom was defined as pain level of none at 2 hours up to 24 hours post-dose with no rescue medication use through 24 hours post-dose.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on mITT participants.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Most Bothersome Symptom (MBS) at 90 Minutes Post-dose
outcome.description: MBS was reported as nausea, photophobia, or phonophobia at migraine onset using the eDiary. Symptom status (absent, present) was assessed post-dose using the eDiary separately for nausea, photophobia, and phonophobia. Freedom from MBS was defined as MBS reported at onset that was absent post-dose.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on mITT participants.

group.title: Rimegepant 75 mg ODT
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of 75 mg of rimegepant ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of matching placebo for rimegepant (75 mg) ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Most Bothersome Symptom (MBS) at 90 Minutes Post-dose
measure.description: MBS was reported as nausea, photophobia, or phonophobia at migraine onset using the eDiary. Symptom status (absent, present) was assessed post-dose using the eDiary separately for nausea, photophobia, and phonophobia. Freedom from MBS was defined as MBS reported at onset that was absent post-dose.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on mITT participants.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Pain at 90 Minutes Post-dose
outcome.description: Pain levels were assessed on a 4-point scale (none, mild, moderate, severe) using the electronic diary (eDiary). Pain freedom was defined as pain level of none.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on mITT participants.

group.title: Rimegepant 75 mg ODT
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of 75 mg of rimegepant ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of matching placebo for rimegepant (75 mg) ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Pain at 90 Minutes Post-dose
measure.description: Pain levels were assessed on a 4-point scale (none, mild, moderate, severe) using the electronic diary (eDiary). Pain freedom was defined as pain level of none.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on mITT participants.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Phonophobia at 2 Hours Post-dose
outcome.description: Phonophobia (sensitivity to sound) status was measured as absent or present in the eDiary. Freedom from phonophobia was defined as phonophobia absent.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on mITT participants with phonophobia present at migraine onset.

group.title: Rimegepant 75 mg ODT
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of 75 mg of rimegepant ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of matching placebo for rimegepant (75 mg) ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Phonophobia at 2 Hours Post-dose
measure.description: Phonophobia (sensitivity to sound) status was measured as absent or present in the eDiary. Freedom from phonophobia was defined as phonophobia absent.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on mITT participants with phonophobia present at migraine onset.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Pain Freedom From 2 to 48 Hours Post-dose
outcome.description: Pain levels were assessed on a 4-point scale (none, mild, moderate, severe) using the eDiary. Sustained pain freedom was defined as pain level of none at 2 hours up to 48 hours post-dose with no rescue medication use through 48 hours post-dose.

outcome.population: The analysis was performed on mITT participants.

outcome.description: Functional disability level was assessed in the eDiary on a 4-point scale: normal function, mild impairment, severe impairment, required bed rest. Freedom from functional disability was defined as normal function.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on mITT participants.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Nausea at 2 Hours Post-dose
outcome.description: Nausea status was measured as absent or present in the eDiary. Freedom from nausea was defined as nausea absent.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on mITT participants with nausea present at migraine onset.

group.title: Rimegepant 75 mg ODT
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of 75 mg of rimegepant ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of matching placebo for rimegepant (75 mg) ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Freedom From Nausea at 2 Hours Post-dose
measure.description: Nausea status was measured as absent or present in the eDiary. Freedom from nausea was defined as nausea absent.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on mITT participants with nausea present at migraine onset.

analysis.p_value_desc: P-Value 0.05; therefore, all secondary endpoints listed after this endpoint in the hierarchy were not tested.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Pain Relapse From 2 to 48 Hours Post-dose
outcome.description: Pain levels were assessed on a 4-point scale (none, mild, moderate, severe) using the eDiary. Pain relapse was defined as pain level of mild, moderate, or severe after 2 hours up to 48 hours post-dose for the participants who were pain-free at 2 hours post-dose.
outcome.time_frame: From 2 hours up to 48 hours post-dose
outcome.population: The analysis population was performed on mITT participants with pain freedom at 2 hours post-dose.

group.title: Rimegepant 75 mg ODT
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of 75 mg of rimegepant ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of matching placebo for rimegepant (75 mg) ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Pain Relapse From 2 to 48 Hours Post-dose
measure.description: Pain levels were assessed on a 4-point scale (none, mild, moderate, severe) using the eDiary. Pain relapse was defined as pain level of mild, moderate, or severe after 2 hours up to 48 hours post-dose for the participants who were pain-free at 2 hours post-dose.
measure.population: The analysis population was performed on mITT participants with pain freedom at 2 hours post-dose.

reported_events.time_frame: Serious adverse events (SAEs) were collected from informed consent up to the end of the study, and adverse events (AEs) were collected from randomization up to end of the study (up to 52 days).
reported_events.desc: The safety population, all enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of rimegepant or placebo, was used to determine the number of participants at risk for SAEs and Other AEs.

group.title: Rimegepant 75 mg ODT
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of 75 mg of rimegepant ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants were administered a single sublingual dose of matching placebo for rimegepant (75 mg) ODT on occurrence of migraine that reached moderate or severe intensity up to 45 days after randomization.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
